title: Cause of Improvement in Ozone Layer

content.question: Which of the following best describes why there has been a reduction in ozone depletion over the last half of the twentieth century?

choices.label: The United States began decreasing <math alttext="C F C " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> emissions under regulations in the Clean Air Act.

Less developed countries developed a global plan to decrease <math alttext="C F C " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> emissions by signing Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation Liability Act (<math alttext="C E R C L A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CERCLA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>).
Several more developed countries signed the Kyoto Protocol as an agreement to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
A global plan to decrease <math alttext="C F C " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> emissions was enacted by signing the Montreal Protocol.

content.answer: A global plan to decrease <math alttext="C F C " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CFC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> emissions was enacted by signing the Montreal Protocol.
